sections.title: How we can help
sections.content:
We offer free and impartial information and guidance to support you to make informed decisions about your money and pensions.

We may ask about your personal or financial situation so we can explain your options and give guidance that fits your needs.

sections.title: We cannot give you financial advice
sections.content: We’re not regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority, so we cannot:
items: give regulated financial or legal advice
recommend specific financial products
access your financial records, including bank accounts and pension details.
sections.footer: If you want specific advice or product recommendations, you’ll need to speak to a regulated financial adviser or legal expert.

sections.title: Important
sections.content:
Do not tell us sensitive information like bank details, your National Insurance number, or pension account numbers.

Read our [Privacy Notice](https://www.moneyhelper.org.uk/en/about-us/privacy-notice) to learn what data we collect and how we use it.

date-of-birth.title: When were you born?
date-of-birth.hint: Enter a two digit day, a two digit month and a four digit year. For example: 15 03 1960

expandable-section.title: Why are we asking this?
expandable-section.content: We want to make sure the guidance we give you is relevant to your age.

appointment-pension-wise.content:
You have to be 50 or over to book a Pension Wise appointment.

We also want to make sure the guidance we give you is relevant to your age.

email.hint: We’ll use this to reply, so avoid using a shared address.
email.error: Please enter a valid email address

phone-number.label: Phone number
phone-number.hint: If you’re not in the UK, include the country code. For example, +44 795555 5555.
phone-number.error: Please enter a valid phone number

expandable-section.title: Why are we asking this?
expandable-section.content:
We’ll use your email or phone number to reply to you. We won’t use it for marketing.

A postcode lets us suggest any helpful services in your area. This this may also be used to analyse trends by location.

enquiry.title: What do you need help with?

money-management.label: Tell us about your situation. The more detail you give, the easier it is for us to help, but don’t include any sensitive financial details, like bank account numbers. It’s also useful if you let us know if you need extra support, like if you're dealing with mental health challenges, have learning difficulties or have trouble accessing services

scams.label: Use this form to tell us what happened or what you're unsure about. The more detail you give, the easier it is for us to help, so include whether you're worried about a scam, fraud, mis-selling or something else. We'll then guide you on what to do next.

debt-advice.label: Let us know any questions or issues you’re having with the Debt advice locator tool. If you need to speak to a debt adviser now, contact [National Debtline](https://nationaldebtline.org/).

insurance-other.label: Use this form to ask our specialists a general insurance question. We can’t give you a quote, but we can explain the different types of insurance, how to find the best deal and who might provide cover that meets your needs.

pensions-state-pension.label: We do not have access to your State Pension records, but you can ask our specialists for general guidance about the State Pension and your forecast. Please don’t include any sensitive financial details, like bank account numbers.

pensions-tracing.label: Use this form if you need help using pension tracing services or have a general question about how to find lost pensions for our specialists. We can’t access pension provider records or search for pensions on your behalf. Please don’t include any sensitive financial details, like bank account numbers.

mhpd.label: Use this form to report a problem with the dashboard, ask how to use it, or send us a question. We do not have access to your State Pension or private pension records, but our specialists can offer general pensions guidance. Please don’t include any sensitive financial details, like bank account numbers.

appointment-pension-wise.label: Use this form to book, change, or cancel a Pension Wise appointment. If you’re booking, please confirm you have a UK-based defined contribution pension pot, you’ve inherited a pension pot or can take your pension early due to ill health. This helps us check you’re eligible for a Pension Wise appointment.

appointment-divorce.label: Tell us if you want to book, change, or cancel an appointment. If you're booking, let us know whether your divorce or dissolution is covered by English, Scottish, Welsh, or Northern Irish law. If you're unsure, it's usually based on where you last lived together as a couple.

pensions-guidance.label: Use this form to ask our specialists for general guidance on pensions and retirement. We don’t have access to your personal or State Pension records and can’t give financial advice, but we can help you understand your pension pot and the options available for retirement planning. Please don’t include any sensitive financial details, like bank account numbers.

text-area.error: Your enquiry must be between 50 and 4,000 characters.

about-scams.title: How we can help
about-scams.sub-title: You don't need to feel embarrassed if you’ve been scammed – we’re here to support you. We can’t recover your money, but we can listen and guide you on what to do next.

sections.content:
We know being targeted by scammers or losing money is distressing, but you’re doing the right thing by contacting us.

We will:
items: never judge or make you feel bad about your situation
treat everything you say in confidence
guide you to trusted organisations who can help
give you practical next steps.

sections.title: If you need help now
sections.content: Call us on [0800 011 3797](tel:08000113797) or [webchat](https://www.moneyhelper.org.uk/en/pensions-chat) (Mon-Fri, 9am to 5pm. Closed bank holidays).

sections.title: Check if something is a scam
sections.content: Seen something suspicious online, in an email or text? [Use Citizens Advice’s scam checker](https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/consumer/scams/check-if-something-might-be-a-scam/).

sections.title: Report a financial fraud or scam
items: In England, Wales or Northern Ireland, visit [Action Fraud](http://www.actionfraud.police.uk/) or call [0300 123 2040](tel:03001232040)
In Scotland, contact [Police Scotland](https://www.scotland.police.uk/contact-us/) on [101](tel:101).

sections.title: MoneyHelper is always free
sections.content: If someone contacts you claiming to be us (or the Money and Pensions Service) and asks you for money, it’s a scam.
Use this form to ask our specialists for more information on scams, fraud or mis-selling.

about-debt.title: How we can help
about-debt.sub-title: We can’t give financial advice, but we can help you find a free debt adviser who will.

sections.content:
If you're struggling with debt, you're not alone. Support is available, and it’s free.

Speak to a debt adviser, who will:
items: explain your options and advise what to do next
check for any benefits you could claim
suggest ways to manage your money
help get you out of debt faster.

callout.title: Find free, confidential debt advice online, over the phone or in your area using our

footer.content:
You can also contact our trusted partner, National Debtline, just call [0808 8084000](tel:08088084000) or [chat online](https://www.moneyhelper.org.uk/en/pensions-chat).

Use this form if you need support using our debt advice locator tool.

about-insurance.title: How we can help
about-insurance.sub-title: We can't provide insurance quotes, but we can direct you to specialist firms that can help.

sections.content:
Travel insurance can be harder to find if you have a serious medical condition or disability.

Our directory lists specialist firms that may offer cover and can give you a quote.

footer.content:
Firms in the directory are authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA).

Learn more about [Insurance](https://www.moneyhelper.org.uk/en/everyday-money/insurance)

about-state-pension.title: How we can help
about-state-pension.sub-title: Use this form to ask us about your State Pension forecast or other general questions.

sections.content: We can’t access your State Pension records, but if you check your forecast on GOV.UK, our specialists can:
items: help you understand what it means
explain how the State Pension works
offer general guidance on pensions and retirement.

sections.content: Use [Check your State Pension forecast on GOV.UK](https://www.gov.uk/check-state-pension) to see:
items: how much you could get
when you can claim
how to boost your State Pension if you're not on track to get the full amount.

sections.content: You can also use [GOV.UK](https://www.gov.uk/browse/working/state-pension) to:
items: find details of your State Pension
ask questions about your own pension
report a change.

about-pension-tracing.title: How we can help
about-pension-tracing.sub-title: We can’t find old or lost pensions for you, but we can show you how to trace them yourself.

sections.content:
We don’t have access to pension providers’ records, but you can search for your pension details in just a few steps.

Start with our guide, [How to find old or lost pensions](https://www.moneyhelper.org.uk/en/pensions-and-retirement/pension-problems/tracing-and-finding-lost-pensions).

You can also use pension tracking services like:
items: The Pension Tracing Service, which lets you [Find pension contact details on GOV.UK](https://www.gov.uk/find-pension-contact-details)
[Gretel](https://www.gretel.co.uk/), a free service to trace lost pensions.

sections.content: Use this form if you need additional support or guidance in using pension tracing and lost pension tracking services.

about-mhpd.title: How we can help
about-mhpd.sub-title: Use this form to report a problem with the MoneyHelper Pensions Dashboard, ask how to use it, or send us a pension question.

sections.content:
MoneyHelper Pensions Dashboard is a free and secure government-backed service.

You can see your pensions all together in one place – including workplace pensions, personal pensions, your State Pension and any you may have lost.

If you need help with the Pensions Dashboard, use this form to:
items: report a problem or something missing
find out how to use it
get guidance on what your pension information means.

sections.content: For more general information, read our guides on [Pensions and Retirement](https://www.moneyhelper.org.uk/en/pensions-and-retirement).

about-money-management.title: How we can help
about-money-management.sub-title: Ask our specialists for free, impartial guidance on all types of money matters.

sections.content:
We can’t offer financial advice, but we can help you understand your options and point you to any useful tools and support.

Get in touch to ask about:
items: **benefits** you may be entitled to claim
**everyday money** like budgeting, banking, credit and car costs
**family and care** costs, including parenting, bereavement, illness, divorce, and long-term care
**homes**, like mortgages or renting
**money troubles**, including help with the cost of living
**savings** and investments
**work and employment** including redundancy, tax and self-employment.

sections.content: Use this form to tell us what you need help with.

about-pension-wise.title: How we can help
about-pension-wise.sub-title: Use this form to book, change or cancel a phone appointment, or ask for more information.

sections.content: Pension Wise appointments offer free, impartial guidance if you have a UK-based defined contribution pension and are:
items: 50 or over
under 50 and retiring early due to poor health, or
under 50 and have inherited a pension.

sections.content:
Choose between an online or telephone appointment.

[Self-guided online appointments](https://prd-pwtriage.moneyhelper.org.uk/en/pension-wise-triage/start) are available to book any time. Your details are saved so you can go at your own pace.

Book or change your free 1-hour telephone appointment using the [Pension Wise booking form](https://www.moneyhelper.org.uk/en/pensions-and-retirement/pension-wise/book-a-free-pension-wise-appointment) or calling [0800 138 3944](tel:08001383944).

 If you’re unable to use the booking form or call, complete this form and we’ll be able to help.

expandable-section.title: What if I’m not eligible for a Pension Wise appointment?
expandable-section.content: If you don’t qualify for a Pension Wise appointment, we can still help you. Go back to the previous page and select ‘Ask a question about pensions’.

about-pension-divorce.title: How we can help
about-pension-divorce.sub-title: Use this form to book, change or cancel a phone appointment, or ask for more information.

sections.content:
If you’re going through a divorce or ending a civil partnership (dissolution), we can help you understand what it means for your pension.

A Pensions and divorce or dissolution appointment lets you speak with one of our pension specialists who will:
items: explain the pension options available during a divorce/dissolution
help you understand what to consider and the questions to ask
guide you on your next steps, including where to find additional help and how to access regulated financial advice if needed.
